org.junit.platform.engine.discovery

Class NameBasedSelectors

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.junit.platform.engine.discovery.NameBasedSelectors

  • @API(value=Experimental)
public final class NameBasedSelectors
extends java.lang.Object
    Collection of static factory methods for creating DiscoverySelectors that select elements by name.

    Consult the documentation for selectName(String) for details on what types of names are supported.

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    ClassSelector, MethodSelector, PackageSelector

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • selectName

        public static DiscoverySelector selectName(java.lang.String name)
                                    throws PreconditionViolationException
        Create a DiscoverySelector for the supplied name.

        Supported Name Types

        • package: fully qualified package name
        • class: fully qualified class name
        • method: fully qualified method name

        The supported format for a fully qualified method name is [fully qualified class name]#[methodName]. For example, the fully qualified name for the chars() method in java.lang.String is java.lang.String#chars. Names for overloaded methods are not supported.

        Parameters:
        name - the name to select; never null or blank
        Returns:
        an instance of ClassSelector, MethodSelector, or PackageSelector
        Throws:
        PreconditionViolationException - if the supplied name is null, blank, or does not specify a class, method, or package
        See Also:
        selectNames(String...), selectNames(Collection)

      • selectNames

        public static java.util.List<DiscoverySelector> selectNames(java.lang.String... names)
        Create a list of DiscoverySelectors for the supplied names.
        Parameters:
        names - the names to select; never null
        Returns:
        a list of DiscoverySelectors for the supplied names; potentially empty
        See Also:
        selectName(String), selectNames(Collection)

      • selectNames

        public static java.util.List<DiscoverySelector> selectNames(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> names)
        Create a list of DiscoverySelectors for the supplied names.
        Parameters:
        names - the names to select; never null
        Returns:
        a list of DiscoverySelectors for the supplied names; potentially empty
        See Also:
        selectName(String), selectNames(String...)
